cleaned_text: What is Herbal Medicine? [Herbal medicine](https://www.naturaltherapypages.com.au/natural_medicine/herbal_medicine), also known as herbalism or herbal healing, is a type of complementary medicine that uses plant-derived substances to treat the body. Plant chemicals are believed to play a vital role in maintaining a balanced energy system in the body, which results in better functioning organs. Some herbs are used as the primary component in the treatment of an illness, while others are used to reinforce the strength of the primary herb. Herbal remedies can be applied topically or taken orally. What are the Benefits of Herbal Medicine? Herbal medicine has been shown to have many benefits when it comes to treating health issues. It is non-invasive and does not pose any side effects when taken as prescribed by a qualified herbalist. Additionally, herbal treatments are generally much less expensive than their pharmaceutical counterparts. Herbal medicine treatment can be used in conjunction with traditional western medicine or as a standalone treatment. Here are some conditions that can be helped by herbal medicine: - Asthma - Diabetes - Arthritis - Breast cancer - Kidney disease - Gout - Psoriasis, eczema and other skin conditions - Hormonal imbalance - Thyroid disease - Multiple sclerosis - Cysts - Oropharyngeal cancer - Prostate cancer - Liver disease - Irritable bowel syndrome - Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) What's the Cost of Herbal Medicine in Brisbane? Herbal medicine practitioners in Brisbane charge between $80 and $150 for consultations. The price will be determined by the dosage and type of herbs used in your herbal medicine. Generally, herbal formulas include 10 to 20 types of herbs tailored to the specific needs of a patient. If you prefer treatment in the comfort of your own home, you can [consult a herbalist remotely](https://www.naturaltherapypages.com.au/natural_medicine/herbal_medicine-online) for a cheaper price. How Many Herbalists Work in Brisbane? There are currently over 3,000 herbal medicine practitioners registered with the Chinese Medicine Board of Australia, and approximately 20% of them are located in Brisbane and throughout Queensland. About a hundred of these practitioners are also registered as herbal dispensers. Many of them work in [holistic clinics](https://www.naturaltherapypages.com.au/natural_medicine/qld/brisbane/holistic_doctor) as well as hospitals and private practices. How Many People in Brisbane Use Herbal Medicine? Although no statistics exist on herbal medicine usage in Brisbane, various sources claim that it is highly prevalent throughout Queensland. According to reports, over a quarter of residents use herbal remedies and supplements to improve their health.
